Introduction.Japanese: こんにちわあ。潜水母艦大鯨です。不束者ですが、よろしくお願い致します。
Introduction.English: Good day, I'm Submarine Tender Taigei. I may be inexperienced, but I am glad to be of service.

Introduction.Japanese: 潜水母艦改装空母の、龍鳳です。航空母艦として、私、頑張ります！
Introduction.English: Carrier Ryuuhou, remodeled from a Submarine Tender. I'll once again try my best as a carrier!

Library.Japanese: 潜水母艦、大鯨です。潜水艦隊旗艦機能と補給物資や水上偵察機を装備して、潜水艦作戦を支援します。いざという時は空母に改装できる空母予備艦として設計されました。頑張ります!
Library.English: I'm Submarine Tender Taigei. I serve as flagship of submarine fleets in order to support operations through supplies and usage of scout planes. I have also been designed as a carrier backup to be converted if it is needed. I'll do my best!

Library.Japanese: 潜水母艦改装空母の龍鳳です。機関の換装の影響で速度は計画通りには出なかったけれど、このクラスの軽空母としては充実の飛行甲板と兵装なんです。空母龍鳳、精一杯頑張ります！
Library.English: Carrier Ryuuhou, remodeled from a Submarine Tender. My speed was not up to plan specifications as there were issues with changing the boilers, but I have an enhanced flight deck and armaments as this Light Carrier class. Carrier Ryuuhou, giving it her all!

Secretary 2.Japanese: 潜水艦と編成ですか？お任せください！
Secretary 2.English: Assigning me with submarines? Just leave it to me!

Secretary 2.Japanese: 不幸…？運が悪い…？え、私が！？そんなこと無いです！
Secretary 2.English: Unfortunate...? Bad luck? Eh, me?! That's just not true!

Secretary 2.Japanese: えっ！？機動部隊の出撃ですか！？
Secretary 2.English: Eh?! A sortie for the mobile squadron?

Secretary 3.Japanese: えっと、この中ですか？玉ねぎや馬鈴薯…あと…補給用の魚雷とか…です…はい…
Secretary 3.English: Um, you're asking me what's in here? Onions, potatoes... and torpedoes for supply use... yeah...

Secretary 3.Japanese: ドーリットル？何か、ちょっと苦手な響きの言葉ですね…何もしない…？何…？
Secretary 3.English: Doolittle? Somehow, the word doesn't ring well with me... Don't do anything...? Huh...?
Secretary 3.Note: She was the only IJN vessel bombed during the Doolittle raid, which delayed her launch as CVL.

Secretary 3.Japanese: もう！輸送艦や防空砲台じゃなくて、私、空母です、空母！
Secretary 3.English: Geez! I'm not a transport, nor an anti-air cannon stand! I'm a carrier, a carrier you know!
Secretary 3.Note: Ryuuhou was left as a AAA stand in Kure till the end of war due to damages suffered.

Idle.Japanese: て・い・と・く、提督！あ、あの…潜水艦作戦は……あっ、しばらくお休み…そ、そうですか…いえ、なんでもないんです…はい……
Idle.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪ Admiral! U-um... about the submarine operations... Ah, a short break... I-I see... No, it's nothing... mmhm...
Idle.Note: Give the subs a rest from running 2-3, okay?

Idle.Japanese: て・い・と・く？提督！あ、あの、空母機動部隊の出撃は？…あ…えっと…暫くお休み？…そ、そうですか…あ、はい…
Idle.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪ Admiral! Um... is Carrier Task Force deploying? Ah, a short break... I-I see, right...

Secretary Married.Japanese: 提督、お疲れではないですか？私、潜水母艦なので、居住性はちょっと自信あります。
Secretary Married.English: Aren't you a little tired, admiral? As I am a Submarine Tender, I am quite confident in my livability.

Secretary Married.Japanese: 提督、お疲れではないですか？私の飛行甲板で少しお休みになられますか？はい！
Secretary Married.English: Aren't you tired, admiral? Want to take a quick nap on my flight deck? Please do!

Wedding.Japanese: 提督…こんな私を、生まれたままの姿で育ててくれて、本当にありがとうございます…いつも、はい、いつも、感謝しています。いつまでも、提督といっしょに…
Wedding.English: Admiral... I thank you from the bottom of my heart for raising me in my default form. I will always, yes, always be thankful. I'll always be besides you...

Wedding.Japanese: 提督、改装空母の私をここまで育ててくれて、本当にありがとうございます。いつも、いつも感謝しています。いつまでも、いつまでも提督の機動部隊に、私…！
Wedding.English: Admiral... I thank you from the bottom of my heart for raising me as a remodeled carrier. I will always, yes, always be thankful. I'll always, always be part of the admiral's mobile squadron!

Looking At Scores.Japanese: 提督？状況把握ですね、大切ですね。
Looking At Scores.English: Admiral? I see you're grasping the situation. It sure is important.

Looking At Scores.Japanese: 提督、どんな状況ですか？　大丈夫？
Looking At Scores.English: Admiral, what is the situation like? Is it okay?

Joining A Fleet.Japanese: 潜水艦隊旗艦、大鯨、出撃します！
Joining A Fleet.English: Submarine Fleet flagship, Taigei, heading out!

Joining A Fleet.Japanese: はい！　航空母艦「龍鳳」、抜錨します！
空母龍鳳の本当の力、お見せしたいと思います！
Joining A Fleet.English: I'd like to show the true power of the Carrier Ryuuhou!

Equipment 1.Japanese: まあ～！ありがとうございます！
嬉しいです、ありがとうございます！
天山って、可愛いと思うんです、私。
Equipment 1.English: I do think the Tenzan are adorable.

Equipment 2.Japanese: ほんとに？ちょっと嬉しいかも。
Equipment 2.English: My, really? I feel a little glad, I suppose.

Equipment 2.Japanese: これなら、敵艦載機に負けません！
Equipment 2.English: With this, I won't lose to the enemy's planes!
Equipment 2.Note: The cause of Marianas Turkey Shoot were also attributed to pilot experience, training and tactics apart from equipment disparities.

Equipment 3.Note: ⇧ shared with expedition selection, resource collection, instant repair and development

Supply.Japanese: はい、ありがとうございます。
艦載機の補充も、感謝いたします!
Supply.English: Thank you for replenishing my planes!
Supply.Note: Nearly all of Ryuuhou's planes were lost in the Marianas Turkey Shoot.

Docking Minor.Japanese: ごめんなさい、ちょっとお風呂に…。
Docking Minor.English: Sorry, I'll be using the bath for a little while.

Docking Minor.Japanese: ちょっとお風呂入りますね。
Docking Minor.English: I'll just be in the bath.

Docking Major.Japanese: すみません、また少しお風呂に…うぅ、電気溶接だとダメなのかしら……。
Docking Major.English: Apologies, I'll be in the bath a little longer... Hmm, I guess electrical welding is no good...
Docking Major.Note: Taigei's hull was warped during construction due to inexperience with arc welding, and she had to be returned to dry dock for repairs shortly after launching. She also had hull weld failures during the Fourth Fleet incident requiring even more repairs.

Docking Major.Japanese: すみません。ちょっと、長いお風呂になるかも
Docking Major.English: Apologies. This may be a long bath.
Docking Major.Note: No need to apologize when Ryuuhou's last bath didn't even start after the March 19 attack which made her irreparable to combat-fit status.

Docking Complete.Japanese: 良かったわぁ。修理完了みたいです。
Docking Complete.English: Thank goodness, it seems like the reparation has been completed.

Docking Complete.Japanese: 良かったぁ。修理完了みたい。
Docking Complete.English: Thank goodness, it seems like the reparation has been completed.

Construction.Japanese: まあ！新しいお仲間が来たみたいです。
Construction.English: Oh my! Seems like a new friend has joined us.

Construction.Japanese: 新しい仲間が来たみたい。
Construction.English: Seems like a new friend has come.

Returning From Sortie.Japanese: 無事帰ってきました。よかったあ。
Returning From Sortie.English: The fleet has safely returned. What a relief.

Returning From Sortie.Japanese: 今回も無事帰って来れました。よかったぁ。
Returning From Sortie.English: We've returned safely this time too. Phew.

Returning From Sortie.Japanese: 無事に母港に戻って来れました。よかったぁ。
Returning From Sortie.English: The fleet has returned safely. What a relief.

Starting A Sortie.Japanese: 潜水母艦、大鯨、抜錨しますね！
機動部隊、出撃です！　勝つ気で参ります！
Starting A Sortie.English: Task force, deploying. I'll go with determination to win!

Battle Start.Japanese: 敵艦発見！…ど…どうしましょう……！
Battle Start.English: Enemy fleet sighted! ...W-what should I do?

Battle Start.Japanese: 気持ちいい…第一攻撃隊、発艦！
Battle Start.English: This feels great... First assault squad, launch!

Air Battle (Ryuuhou).Japanese: 七面鳥ですか？！　誰が…私の…？　いいえ、精鋭たちです！侮らないで！
Air Battle (Ryuuhou).English: Turkey?! Are you saying I'm one? I'm sorry, but we're the elite. Don't underestimate us!
Air Battle (Ryuuhou).Note: The IJN's greatly reduced naval air power led to the so-called 'Turkey Shoot' at the Marianas, where planes were shot down quite easily by the US fleet

Air Battle (Ryuuhou).Japanese: 私達、改装空母をなめないで！
Air Battle (Ryuuhou).English: Don't make light of us remodeled carriers!

Attack.Japanese: 続けていきます！　龍鳳、攻撃隊、発艦！
Attack.English: There's more coming! Ryuuhou assault squadron, launch!
Attack.Note: The 2 waves of planes Ryuuhou sent out were lost in the Marianas Turkey Shoot.

Attack.Japanese: 艦載機があれば、私だって！
Attack.English: Even I can fight if I have planes!
Attack.Note: ⇧ shared with day/night special attacks, support expedition team arrival

Night Battle.Japanese: この武装で艦隊戦は…無理かもー！
Night Battle.English: A fleet battle with these armaments... it might be impossible!

Night Battle.Japanese: 追撃に移行します。全艦、突撃！
Night Battle.English: Moving into the chase. All ships, launch assault!

Night Attack.Japanese: 当たって…当たってぇー！

MVP.Japanese: えっ…嘘…わ、わたし！？…あっ、ありがとうございます…が、頑張ります！
MVP.English: Eh... no way! M-me?! T-thank you so much... I'll keep giving it my all!

MVP.Japanese: 私の艦載機が活躍したの？　や、やったー！　これが空母の、龍鳳の力なんです！
MVP.English: My planes did great? H-hurray! This is the strength of the Carrier Ryuuhou!
MVP.Note: Not the case in the Marianas Turkey Shoot unfortunately.

Minor Damage 2.Japanese: やだ！飛行甲板の格納庫が！！
Minor Damage 2.English: Oh no, my flight deck hangar!
Minor Damage 2.Note: Ryuuhou's hangar was hit by TF58 aircrafts on March 19, 1945. The attack effectively put her out of combat and she was left sitting in Kure on AA duties till the end of the war.

Major Damage.Japanese: ちょ…直撃！？もっ…もうやだぁ……排水を急いで！沈んじゃう…！
Major Damage.English: Wha- a direct hit?! N-no more... increase the rate of draining! I'm gonna sink...!

Major Damage.Japanese: やられました…エレベーターが……でも、まだ大丈夫、沈みません！
Major Damage.English: They got me! The elevator has been... but don't worry, I'm not sinking!
Major Damage.Note: Ryuuhou's elevators were so damaged on March 19 that the portion of flight deck between them bulged upwards.

Sunk.Japanese: え…私、沈むの…？…これが…みずの…なか……
Sunk.English: Eh... I'm... sinking? So this is what it's like... to be in the water...

Sunk.Japanese: 空母として、沈むのね…今度は活躍、できた…かな？
Sunk.English: Sinking as a carrier... did I manage to accomplish a lot this time...?

00:00.Japanese: ちょうど午前零時です。すっかり深夜ですね。お疲れじゃないですか？
00:00.English: It's midnight now. It sure has gotten late. Are you tired?

01:00.Japanese: マルヒトマルマル。提督、深夜ですよ？
01:00.English: 0100. Admiral, it's already late into the night, you know?

02:00.Japanese: マルフタマルマル。提督、お休みにならなくていいのですか？
02:00.English: 0200. Admiral, are you sure you don't need to rest?

03:00.Japanese: マルサンマルマル。ふはぁ、私も少し眠くなってしまいました…だ、大丈夫！ふあぁ…
03:00.English: 0300. Geez, I'm starting to feel a little sleepy, too... I-I'm fine! Yawn...

04:00.Japanese: マルヨンマルマル。だ、大丈夫です！格納庫の天山数えて起きているので、大丈夫。
04:00.English: 0400. D-don't worry! I've been keeping myself awake by counting the number of Tenzan in my hangar.

05:00.Japanese: マルゴーマルマル。提督、朝です！お早いですね？まさか、徹夜でしょうか…
05:00.English: 0500. It's morning, Admiral! You're up early... don't tell me you stayed up all night...

06:00.Japanese: マルロクマルマル。朝ごはんは何がいいですか？流石に朝からカレーは重いですよね…
06:00.English: 0600. What should we have for breakfast? I guess curry is a little too heavy for the morning...

07:00.Japanese: マルナナマルマル。提督、朝ごはんはお味噌汁と卵焼き、鮭の切り身を焼いてみました。さぁ、召し上がれ！
07:00.English: 0700. Admiral, I tried making miso soup with fried eggs along with fried salmon fillets for breakfast. Dig in!

08:00.Japanese: マルハチマルマル。さぁ、今日も元気に頑張りましょう！ね？提督！？
08:00.English: 0800. Now, let's get through the day with zeal! Right, admiral?

09:00.Japanese: マルキュウマルマル。鎮守府のお掃除もしたいですね。私、掃き掃除しますね！
09:00.English: 0900. I want to clean the base. I'm off to do some sweeping!

10:00.Japanese: ヒトマルマルマル。けっこうホコリも溜まっていますね。提督も一緒に、はい、これ持って？
10:00.English: 1000. There sure is dust gathered. Give me a hand, Admiral. Here, hold this.

11:00.Japanese: ヒトヒトマルマル。お掃除すると、お腹がすきますね…お昼ご飯は何にしましょうか？
11:00.English: 1100. Cleaning sure makes you hungry. What shall we have for lunch?

12:00.Japanese: ヒトフタマルマル。今日のお昼ご飯は、大げぇ…じゃなかった、龍鳳特製カレーです！
12:00.English: 1200. Lunch today is Taige--er, I mean, Ryuuhou's specialty curry!

13:00.Japanese: ヒトサンマルマル。龍鳳特製カレー、いかがでしたか？馬鈴薯もおいしいでしょ？
13:00.English: 1300. How was my specialty curry? The potato was good too, right?

14:00.Japanese: ヒトヨンマルマル。提督、あのぉ、そろそろ本格的な機動部隊を…あ、まだ？…はいぃ…
14:00.English: 1400. Um, Admiral, it's time for the mobile squadron to- ah, not yet? Okay...

15:00.Japanese: ヒトゴーマルマル。提督、そろそろ本格的に、空母機動部隊が出撃ですよね？…ね！？
15:00.English: 1500. Admiral, it's now time for the carrier squadron to sortie, right? Right?

16:00.Japanese: ヒトロクマルマル。なんだか、夕焼け空が綺麗…もう夕方ですね。
16:00.English: 1600. The seared sky sure is beautiful... it's already evening, huh.

17:00.Japanese: ヒトナナマルマル。そろそろ、お夕食の準備をしないと。提督、何がいいでしょう？
17:00.English: 1700. Have to prepare dinner soon. What would you like, Admiral?

18:00.Japanese: ヒトハチマルマル。お昼はカレーですし、夜は少し凝ったものがいいでしょうか…
18:00.English: 1800. Since we had curry for lunch, I guess we should have something more exquisite...

19:00.Japanese: ヒトキュウマルマル。提督、今晩はフーカデンビーフにしてみました。どうでしょう？
19:00.English: 1900. Admiral, I tried making Fricandeau Beef. How is it?
19:00.Note: A type of beef mixed with egg and onion and cooked in a roughly oval/tube shape.

20:00.Japanese: フタマルマルマル。フーカデンビーフ、いかがでしたか？…ふふ、良かったぁ！
20:00.English: 2000. How was the Fricandeau Beef? Hehe... great to hear!

21:00.Japanese: フタヒトマルマル。提督、洗い物片付けたら、明日の作戦の計画を立てましょう？
21:00.English: 2100. Admiral, want to go draft up tomorrow's operation plans after we clean up?

22:00.Japanese: フタフタマルマル。明日こそ、本格的な空母機動部隊による出撃を…ね、提督！？
22:00.English: 2200. Tomorrow WILL be the day when the mobile squadron get to sortie... Right, Admiral?!

23:00.Japanese: フタサンマルマル。提督、本日も一日、大変お疲れ様でした。明日も頑張りましょう？
23:00.English: 2300. Admiral, this sure has been another tiring day. Shall we also do our best tomorrow?

Christmas 2016.Japanese: て・い・と・く♪　クリスマスですね。　私、腕を奮っちゃいます！　お料理のリクエスがあったら、言ってくださいね？
Christmas 2016.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪ It's Christmas. I'm gonna show you everything I've got! If you have any cooking requests, please let me know, okay?

Early Summer 2016.Japanese: て…い…と…く、え？なんですか？水着ですか？一応用意してあるのですが…え？今ですか？夏まで待っててくださいね。
Early Summer 2016.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪ Eh, what is it? A swimsuit, is it? I did have one prepared, just in case, but... Eh? Right now? Please patiently wait until summer, alright?

New Year 2016.Japanese: 提督、あ、あの・・・潜水母艦、いいですよね？必要ですよね？ああ、よかった！はい、潜水艦たちのお世話はお任せ下さい！
New Year 2016.English: Admiral... ah, um... submarine tenders sure are nice, aren't they? They're a necessity, right? Ah, thank goodness! Yes, leave the care of the submarines to me!

New Year 2016.Japanese: 提督、あ、あの・・・低速軽空母だって十分戦えますよね？ね？私、信じてます！
New Year 2016.English: Admiral, ah, um... even as a slow light aircraft carrier, I'm still sufficient enough for battles, right? Right? I believe so!

New Year 2017.Japanese: て、い、と、く？提督、新年あけましておめでとうございます。本年もどうぞ宜しくお願い致します。
New Year 2017.English: Commander, Happy New Year. Please look after me this year too!

Sanma 2016.Japanese: 艦隊で秋刀魚漁支援ですか？了解しました！あ、磯風さんも準備万端ですね～よし！
Sanma 2016.English: Supporting the saury fishing with the rest of the fleet? Affirmative! Ah, Isokaze-san is fully prepared as well, aren't you. Alright then!

Sanma 2016.Japanese: 艦隊全力で秋刀魚漁支援ですか？龍鳳、了解しました！磯風さん、浜風さんも、準備万端ですね？
Sanma 2016.English: Supporting the saury fishing with the fleet's full force? Affirmative! Isokaze-san, Hamakaze-san, are your preparations done?

Setsubun 2017.Japanese: 節分なんですけど…潜水艦の子たちが…痛い！や、やだ！いた！も、もういやだ！あーやめて！もう降参だからー！
Setsubun 2017.English: It's Setsubun, isn't it...Oh no, there's those Submarine kids...Ow! Noooo! Ow! Please no more! Noo, stop it! I told you to stop that alreadyyy!

Setsubun 2017.Japanese: 節分なんですけど…さすがに空母になった私には潜水艦の子たちは…痛い！え？どうして？いた！いたたたた！も、もう、もうやめて！どうして？もう！
Setsubun 2017.English: It's Setsubun isn't it....Well naturally now that I've become a carrier I'll be safe from those Submarine ki-OW! Eh? Why me? Ow! Owowowowowow! Please, Please stop it! Why is it still me? Jeez!

Fifth Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く、おめでとうございます！艦隊はついに、五周年を迎えました！大鯨も、お祝い申し上げます！祝賀のお料理がんばりますね。
Fifth Anniversary.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪, congratulations! The fleet is finally celebrating it’s 5th Anniversary! I’d like to congratulate you too! I’ll work hard on making food for the celebration.

Fifth Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く！おめでとうございます！艦隊はついに五周年を迎えました。龍鳳もお祝い申し上げます。祝賀の料理、がんばりますね。
Fifth Anniversary.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪, congratulations! The fleet is finally celebrating it’s 5th Anniversary! I’d like to congratulate you too! I’ll work hard on making food for the celebration.

Sixth Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く、おめでとうございます。艦隊は、この春また、新たの歴史を刻むことができました。お祝いとお礼申し上げます。
Sixth Anniversary.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪, congratulations. This spring, the fleet has marked a new page in it's history. I offer my sincerest thanks and congratulations.

Autumn 2016.Japanese: あぁ、時雨さん、お疲れ様です。えぇ、秋はバルジが…？そうですね、時雨さんは大丈夫ですけど、私気をつけなきゃ…。
Autumn 2016.English: Ah, thanks for your hard work, Shigure. Eh, the autumn bulge…? That’s right, you’re fine but I need to be careful…

Saury Festival 2016.Japanese: 艦隊で秋刀魚漁支援ですか？了解しました！あぁ、磯風さんも準備万端ですね！よし！
Saury Festival 2016.English: The fleet is going to support saury fishing? Roger that! Ah, Isokaze is ready too! Alright!

Saury Festival 2016.Japanese: 艦隊全力で秋刀魚漁支援ですか？龍鳳、了解しました！磯風さん、浜風さんも、準備万端ですね？
Saury Festival 2016.English: The whole fleet is going to support saury fishing? Roger that! Isokaze, Hamakaze; are you ready?

End of Year 2016.Japanese: 鳳翔さんどうされたんですか？そうか、鎮守府の大掃除ですね。私も手伝えいたします。あぁ、はい！まず、掃き掃除ですね？
End of Year 2016.English: What are you doing, Houshou-san? I see, it’s the Naval Base’s spring cleaning. I’ll help too. Ah, yes! First we’ll be sweeping right?

Valentine’s Day 2017.Japanese: て・い・と・く！はい、大鯨からのチョコレート、どうか受け取ってください！あ、ありがとうございます！
Valentine’s Day 2017.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪! Here, please accept my chocolates! Th-thank you very much!

Valentine’s Day 2017.Japanese: て・い・と・く！はい、龍鳳からのチョコレート、どうか受け取ってください！あ、ありがとうございます！
Valentine’s Day 2017.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪! Here, please accept my chocolates! Th-thank you very much!

Hinamatsuri 2017.Japanese: ひな祭り、ひな人魚かわいいですね。潜水艦たちもかわいく…あれ？菱餅が…おかしいは…確かに…また良いしなくちゃ。
Hinamatsuri 2017.English: It’s Hinamatsuri, the hina dolls are cute. The submarines are cute too… Huh? The hishimochi is… That’s strange… I’m sure… I have to make them again.

White Day 2017.Japanese: もしかしてこちらを私に？ありがとうございます！私、だいじにだいじに頂きます！
White Day 2017.English: Could this be for me? Thank you very much! I’ll really, really savour this!

Spring 2017.Japanese: お花見ですか？おまかせください！お重いっぱいにお料理詰めて馳せ参じますね。あの子達何好きかしら？
Spring 2017.English: Cherry blossom viewing? Leave it to me! I’ll hurry and fill an ojyuu with lots of food. I wonder what those girls would like?

4th Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く、おめでとう御座います。艦隊は四周年を迎えました。大鯨もお祝い申し上げます。祝賀のお料理、作りますね！
4th Anniversary.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪, congratulations. The fleet’s 4th Anniversary is here. I give you my regards. I’ll cook something for the celebrations!

4th Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く、おめでとう御座います。艦隊は四周年を迎えました。龍鳳もお祝い申し上げます。祝賀のお料理、作りますね！
4th Anniversary.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪, congratulations. The fleet’s 4th Anniversary is here. I give you my regards. I’ll cook something for the celebrations!

Late Autumn 2017.Japanese: 少し寒きなって来ましたね。かぜを引かないようにしないと。提督も暖かくしてくださいね。
Late Autumn 2017.English: It’s gotten a bit colder. I hope that I won’t catch a cold. You better keep warm too, Admiral.

5th Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く、おめでとうございます！艦隊はついに、五周年を迎えました！大鯨も、お祝い申し上げます！祝賀のお料理がんばりますね。
5th Anniversary.English: Congratulations, Ad-mi-ral! The fleet is finally celebrating it’s 5th Anniversary! I’d like to congratulate you too! I’ll work hard on making food for the celebration.

5th Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く！おめでとうございます！艦隊はついに五周年を迎えました。龍鳳もお祝い申し上げます。祝賀の料理、がんばりますね。
5th Anniversary.English: Congratulations, Ad-mi-ral! The fleet is finally celebrating it’s 5th Anniversary! I’d like to congratulate you too! I’ll work hard on making food for the celebration.

6th Anniversary.Japanese: て・い・と・く、おめでとうございます。艦隊は、この春また、新たの歴史を刻むことができました。お祝いとお礼申し上げます。
6th Anniversary.English: Ad~mi~ral~♪, congratulations. This spring, the fleet has marked a new page in it's history. I offer my sincerest thanks and congratulations.
